text: Charles Pierre Baudelaire (9 April 1821 – 31 August 1867) was a French symbolist and modernist poet and art critic. He is best known for his volume of poetry Les Fleurs du mal (The Flowers of Evil) in 1857. Baudelaire was born in Paris, and studied law at the Lycée Louis-le-Grand in Paris. Baudelaire's first publication was his art review Salon of 1845. == References == == Other websites == * * Works by or about Charles Baudelaire (Internet Archive) Category:1821 births Category:1867 deaths Category:French poets
title: Charles Baudelaire
